result.execSummary:
The defendant Kylie Annabelle Metevia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfering/obstructing officers. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:22 PM Defendant Kylie Annabelle Metevia in court.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Kylie Annabelle Metevia.  Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
State moves to amend the charges to an Ordinance violation.
Plea - Cts 1&2 - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
$50+cc on each count, pp $50/mo beg 1-15-23

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No violent contact with parents.  Take prescriptions as prescribed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
***8-31-22 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE CONDITION TO TAKE PRESCRIPTIONS AS PRESCRIBED***

2:09 PM Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Kylie Annabelle Metevia.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft's appearance was waived for today.
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting that bond be modified to remove the condition of taking prescriptions as prescribed.
Argument made by Defense.
State will leave the matter up to the Court.
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Modify bond to remove the prescription condition, all other conditions remain, matter adjourned.
